com.marklogic.hub.deploy.commands

Class CreateGranularPrivilegesCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marklogic.client.ext.helper.LoggingObject
      • com.marklogic.hub.deploy.commands.CreateGranularPrivilegesCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.marklogic.appdeployer.command.Command, com.marklogic.appdeployer.command.UndoableCommand

    public class CreateGranularPrivilegesCommand
extends com.marklogic.client.ext.helper.LoggingObject
implements com.marklogic.appdeployer.command.Command, com.marklogic.appdeployer.command.UndoableCommand
    Command for creating granular privileges after the resources that these privileges depend on have been created.

    See the comments on saveGranularPrivileges for important information about how this class attempts to avoid causing an error by trying to create a privilege with the same action as an existing one.

      • buildGranularPrivileges

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.marklogic.mgmt.api.security.Privilege> buildGranularPrivileges(com.marklogic.mgmt.ManageClient manageClient)
        Parameters:
        manageClient -
        Returns:
        a map of privilege action, containing an ID, and a Privilege object to be saved. The key must be an action with an ID so that we can determine if a privilege with the same action already exists.

      • saveGranularPrivileges

        protected void saveGranularPrivileges(com.marklogic.mgmt.ManageClient manageClient,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.marklogic.mgmt.api.security.Privilege> granularPrivileges)
        Save each of the given privileges. For each key in the map - where the key is expected to be an action with a resource ID in it - we check to see if an existing privilege has the same action. If so, then the roles in the granular privilege are added to that existing privilege. This ensures we never cause an error by trying to create a privilege with the same action as an existing one. This is crucial for DHS, as the DHS config will create some of the same granular privileges that DHF needs to create (but with a different name).
        Parameters:
        manageClient -
        granularPrivileges -
